articles.headline: Quantum Circuits Just Got Smarter: AlphaTensor-Quantum Cuts T-Count Without Retraining
articles.hook: Why should an undergrad care about this? If you’re studying computer science or physics, this breakthrough could shape the future of quantum computing—making circuits faster, cheaper, and more scalable than ever before.
articles.difficulty: Sophomore-level, requiring foundational knowledge in quantum mechanics, machine learning, and linear algebra.

articles.headline: How AI is Revolutionizing Metasurface Design: A Bridge Between Theory and Innovation
articles.hook: Imagine designing materials that manipulate light with the precision of a nanoscale engineer—this research is making it possible, using AI to solve problems you’ll encounter in your physics or materials science courses.
articles.difficulty: Sophomore-level (requires foundational knowledge of physics, math, and computer science).
